basis the second stage is the foundation stage after expiry experiencing the

on the customers environment and the output is used to build a directional

application to a SS cloud in waves before jumping into the details of the
migration readiness assessment MRA it is important to first understand the EDA Blair's cloud adoption framework CAF the
AWS cloud adoption framework organizes guidance into six areas of focus called
perspectives each perspectives cover artistic responsibility owned or managed
by a functionally related stakeholder in general to business people and
governance perspective focuses on business capabilities while the platform security and operation perspectives
focuses on the technical capabilities it is important to understand CAF before
carrying out MRA the migration readiness assessment is
carried out as part of the assessment phase the migration readiness assessment is a process of assessing the customers
current state and identifying their cloud adoption readiness gaps the
assessment is carried out in a plan workshop together with the customers stakeholder through a set of
questionnaires that are aligned with the cloud adoption framework the 'memory
provides an opportunity to listen learn and influence the customers stakeholders
besides that its main aim is to understand the customers environment better and to determine the scope of the
migration readiness and planning engagement here is a summary of the
outcome of the migration readiness assessment it is very important for the
customer to have consensus of their current state and be aware of the earth
cloud readiness gaps earlier in the migration to prevent roadblocks as for
the partner the MRA helps them build trust with the customer and gain insights of the customers work processes
and environment having completed the migration readiness assessment it is
time to precisely plan for the migration through the migration readiness and planning phase MRP the migration
engagement flow which is part of the migration plan consists of eight work streams of sprint delivered through
agile methodology these work streams focuses on closing the MRA gaps planning
the customers cloud environment using the a SS best practices and building a
repeatable migration methodology called the migration Factory it is important to
note that the actual migration only happens in the next phase after the MRP
scope of work has been signed off by the customer here's the summary of the
outcomes of the migration readiness and planning phase to discovery and planning
covers to detailed application profiling which provides data on application
performance metrics due to and integration the output of the
discovery phase is used to derive a detailed business case for the migration the landing zone is the customers

plan the landing zone using the AWS landing zone best practices security has
always been job zero in AWS hence ensuring security and compliance

application undergo three sub phases which are activated execute and optimize

types the applications are also grouped based on their integration needs and

the migration issue 'l will then be part of the migration activity team defining

achieved through a SS trainings and certification the second important
ingredient to have in a migration practice is a clear definition of migration phases and their outcomes

practice has well-defined faces with clear outcomes for each phase as for the

practice and set to delivery outcomes of each phase clearly the third most

AWS there are two groups of tools that can be leveraged as part of the migration Factory the first group of

discovery service can be used to perform rapid discovery this service supports
port agent and agentless deployments and it can be used without charge in the

server database and data a SS Server migration service is an agentless tool

hand the AWS database migration service is an agent service that supports
